intro: Echinospermum bornmuelleri, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
